alert.note: Alert for Henry; Houston (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 16 at 11:26PM CDT until June 17 at 12:00AM CDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT CDT FOR SOUTHERN HENRY AND HOUSTON COUNTIES... At 1125 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Webb, or 9 miles southeast of Headland, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Cottonwood, Headland, Dothan, Taylor, Midland City, Kinsey, Ashford, Cowarts, Webb, Columbia, Rehobeth, Avon, Newville, Madrid, Gordon, Haleburg, Memphis, Crosby, Grangeburg and Hayes. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. To report severe weather contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in Tallahassee.
